IRS990.MissionDesc: Trolley Museum-education, restoration, preservation with concentration on the era from the late 1800s though mid 1900s.
IRS990.Desc: Education - Historical Museum Programs, General/Other: Operation and Display of Trolley Cars and related equipment with the expressed purpose to educate all ages about this historical era. Over 170 hours of volunteer time per week during the season is used for this purpose. An additional 1000 volunteer hours or more is spent during the year setting up and revising the displays. Of the 15,500 volunteer hours recorded in 2018, over 10,000 hours were spent interacting with the public. Two educators were hired to interact with the public during the regular season. They were trained to operate and understand the functions of the trolleys & the history their operation in the United States.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Restoration - Historical Museum Programs, General/Other: Restoration - To restore Trolleys, Railroad and related Equipment from this historical era. Over 1550 volunteer hours were used in 2018 for this purpose. In addition contracted labor is being used to supplement the restoration of Trolley Car 3001, and Car 3100. Car 169 continues to be restored. In order to restore our collection, a quality Restoration/Repair Shop must be available. In 2017 it was decided that a full restoration of car 3001 would be the goal of CERA. A major fundraising campaign was started for 3001. In addition to numerous smaller donations, a $25,000 matching grant was awarded and the State of CT awarded a grant of $50,000 on 12/14/2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Preservation - Historical Museum Programs, General/Other: Preservation - Trolley Cars, Railroad and related equipment through the proper storage with the expressed purpose of preserving the equipment from this historical era. Although Volunteer time varies each year for this purpose, over 1000 Volunteer hours per year is spent on the facilities plus moving the trolleys and other historical equipment into existing barns & the Visitor Center. Additionally, contracted labor was used on the Visitor Center,Trolley Storage Barns and support facilities in 2018.

ProgramServiceRevenueGrp.Desc: Yourth Rails to the Dark Side Rides & Exhibits
Children Easter Bunny Fun Rides & Exhibits

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERA has no Stockholders. CERA has Voting Members that meet at least once each year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERA Members vote annually for approximately 1/3 of the Board of Directors however in the event of the resignation or death of a member of the Board during his/her term, the Board may appoint a replacement to fill the remaining term.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CERA Members approve the actions of the Board of Directors and Officers at the Annual Meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All CERA Committees are advisory in nature and require Board action.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors reviews the information furnished by the Treasurer and Volunteer Staff Accountant at the January Board Meeting. Any changes to the accounting records are reviewed at subsequent Board meetings as they are made. A draft of the IRS 990 Report is sent to each Board Member. At the next Board Meeting, the final IRS 990 is reviewed and approved. At the Annual Meeting, the members approve the actions of the Board of Directors including the final IRS 990 Report.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All documents are available upon request to the Corporate Secretary. Some documents are placed on the CERA website (www.CT-Trolley.org) and are also available at the CERA Visitor Center. The final IRS 990 is also available on the Guide Star website.
